body: It gave my five years old beagle huge seizures I thought this could never happen with such an expensive and reputable brand of dog food like Hill’s Science, even recommended by veterinarians, causing my dog to get near death huge seizures. Seizures did not start after several weeks until my dog had gone through about half the 24-pound bag of Hill’s Science dog food, when I noticed every time he finished eating his bowl of food, he would go to sleep for a while only to wake up drooling. He would then beg me to let him go out to the backyard. Once in the yard, he started wondering around walking slowly, eating grass and getting more confused and drooling more and more. Then the big seizure came next, his entire body would start shaking, his eyes would turn watery and brick red colored, and then his four legs would lock and get completely stretched out to the point that he could still be stood up but painfully take short steps with his four legs locked straight and with his back curved into an arch. It was like he had received a high voltage shock. Each of the frightening seizure episodes lasted for about twenty to thirty minutes and then it slowly stopped. After seeing him in two occasions vomit his entire full bowl of undigested pellets, I slowly put the pieces together that the cause of his seizures could be Hill’s food because I did not feed him any treats of any other kind of food. I got rid of half the bag of Hill’s Science and switched him to Chicken Soup for the Soul. He was fine for a week or so but still I had to feed him a lot less and he started to lose too much weight so I decided to give it a try to Blue Buffalo Freedom Grain Free Natural Adult Dry Dog Food. These pellets are half the size of Hill’s Science. They are triangular shaped intermixed with small size bb shaped pellets even smaller than those of Chicken Soup for the Soul.Three weeks went by without any seizures. So I hope it stays that way. After our frightening ordeal was over, out of curiosity, it occurred to me to run a simple experiment with a few pellets I kept from his Hill’s Science food. First, I tried unsuccessfully smashing one pellet with my fingers with no success. Then I dropped a few pellets in a small bowl of water and after 15 minutes had passed, I pressed them as hard as I could with my thumb to see if I was able to smash them into a soft mass but I could not because the center was too compact and hard as plastic; much less seeing them dissolve in the water on their own. How could a poor dog digest such large and hard pellets? What kind of glue was in the pellets’ formula to make them so unbreakable? But then again, besides the Hill’s pellet’s compactness and roughness, I do not know if the issue with Hill’s dog food is that some of its ingredients are highly allergenic. So be careful, watch your dog’s behavior and if it drools and has seizures after eating, look no more, it is very likely his food. Be strong and do not succumb to your veterinarian pressure to put your dog under epileptic drugs. First try finding the right food before you put your dog under such harsh drugs. I hope I am able to save the reader from frightening and sad events like mine and in the process preserve a dog’s health and save its life.

body: Absolutely love this Amazon prompted me to rate this on it's flavor? I'm not about to try dog food but my Bullmastiff seems to love it so I'll say that it must be tasty. A while back my dog would become randomly sick, shooting liquid lava like poop from himself while making a horrible balloon popping sound. It would happen on and off. Took him to a vet the first time, they said he must've ate something bad. Resumed our normal schedule. He became sick again later. Took him to another vet who diagnosed him properly, we were given an $80 bag of Royal Canin which completely cured all digestive issues along with the use of a powered prebiotic and antibiotics for safety measures. When it came time to reorder dog food I had hoped there was a cheaper alternative out there to Royal Canine that wouldn't upset his tummy. Hill's Science dog food (sensitive stomach and skin recipe, chicken flavor) proved it's worth. It was like I had not switched him from Royal Canin at all. Now that we're running low on the small bag of Hill's I initially ordered I'm ordering the large 30lb bag. Very very pleased with this company, I'm hoping that this review also helps dog parents in my similar position find a good replacement food for the Royal Canin. It works just the same and costs less!

body: Best Dog Food Ever! My family and I recently adopted a 3-year-old pit bull from our local shelter. The shelter originally gave him Hill's Science Diet and gave us a small bag to take home with us.  We switched over to the other brand after finishing the bag, I bought him another dog food called "Gentle Giants World Class Canine Nutrition Dog and Puppy Food Classic Quality of Life Chicken Feast". That was a big mistake, my dog had a terrible experience with the dog food. He had diarrhea almost every day. I had to wake up early in the morning to clean his bed of poop. If it wasn't diarrhea, it was vomit and he would be vomiting out small portions of the food. He would also have very irregular poops that ranged from watery to a poop that could barely hold a shape. It was a terrible experience that lasted 2 months. I thought it was just my dog specifically who was having these problems because we just got him from the shelter. When we got him, he was freshly neutered and was emaciated, but that wasn't the case at all. After switching back over to Hill's my dog's health has changed tremendously, starting from day one! He now has more regular poops and no longer vomits or has diarrhea in the middle of the night. I highly recommend this brand of dog food. If your pet is having stomach troubles or any skin troubles like mine [he's a pitbull, a lot of them usually have little bumps on their skin or other problems because their skin is sensitive] this "Hill's Science Diet Dry Dog Food, Adult, Sensitive Stomach & Skin Recipes" is the best!

body: I'm a (UNSPONSERED) Veterinary Student and Won't Feed My Dog Anything Else! My dog is not a picky eater by any means, but she LOVES this food and it has made her a healthy girl! I adopted my pup from the Bahamas when I was a veterinary technician. She was VERY thin when I got her and her fur was dull, she had constant Gastrointestinal issues and even after hundreds in veterinary bills and after several dewormings and rounds of probiotics, the damage done to her GI tract from her days on the streets seemed irreversible... She had bloody diarrhea and her belly would rumble so strongly that I could see it from the outside!  Since I switched her to this food her gastrointestinal issues have seemed to disappear besides the occasional diarrhea when she is very stressed, her fur is also much shinier, her skin is less itchy, and she is a perfect body condition score! Now that I am a veterinary student, I usually get a large discount on this food through the Hill's VIP website, but due to COVID, their shipping has been very unreliable (took 3 MONTHS for a 5 day order!) and Amazon will overnight it to me for free as a Prime member, so it is worth it because I would not put my baby girl on any other food! Pictures show before (first pic on the red tile at shelter) and after (pic in office chair 1 year after adoption). Just in case you wonder if I'm paid off by Hill's, no way! I will never accept a sponsorship although my tuition is about $200,000, I want pet owners to trust my recommendations!

body: This food Saved my Relationship My boyfriend moved in a few months ago with his 35 lb Aussie. I didn't notice the packaging indicating a change until the previous bag of food was almost empty.  I don't know that I would have thought to slowly transition him from one bag to the next in any case as the dog food is specifically for dogs with sensitive stomachs.  OMG. On consuming food from the new bag, my dog immediately developed painfully explosive diarrhea.  I fed him rice for a few days and then attempted to reintroduce the food combined with rice.  He just cannot tolerate it even in small portions.  I called the company help line and learned they had increased the vitamin E component.  I thought I should warn others. You may need to transition carefully from the old formula to the new.

body: Allergic reaction- not equivalent to prescription formula We slowly transitioned our dog into this food,  mixing it with his previous similar food,  until fully transitioned. Due to Corona we ordered this as we couldn’t get our script version. After full 100% conversation our very chill, low maintenance  dog started chewing his paws incessantly and becoming irritated. Nothing else has changed- we even started cleaning his paws after any outside walks etc. we also thought we must be missing something he was eating on the leashed walks because his stomach constantly made loud gurgle sounds. We realized the only thing that has changed was his food. He gets zero human treats etc. so the only difference was this food. His old food does not have the carrots, apples and cranberry so it must be a reaction to one of those. Ingredients. Now on  black his old food and slowlly recovering. The vet said just that simple change caused the allergic reaction. This is NOT equivalent to the prescription version.

body: Finally listened to vet and glad I did Our english bulldog puppy had terribly loose stools when we first got her and fed her breeder recommended Royal Canin. I stayed with that for a while then transferred her to Honest Kitchen. She loved that food but the work involved for mixing and storing had its drawbacks. Our vet carried Hills Science Diet, but I had read online that vets were paid to carry it, so instead I read, and read, and read everything I could get my hands on and finally decided to try a grain free food for our dog. She loved it, her stools were great, her coat was perfect, and we thought we found the solution. Till she developed a rash...and I took her to the vet and he asked what I was feeding her.i was so frustrated at the process we had undergone to find the perfect food only for her to get a rash, I told him I was not feeding her HIS recommended Hills Science Diet. He looked at me and told me grain free dog foods are now being linked to canine heart disease! I took a bag of Hills Sensitive Stomach just to appease him as I pondered what I would do with the 50 pound bag of "bad" grain-free food I had just ordered!!  I came home and did more research only to find our vet was our dogs best friend. The food i was using was very high quality, but was also on the list as one of the worst I could choose for heart disease. As I read in another post, TALK TO YOUR VET. TRUST YOUR VET! I had been told Science Diet paid vets to carry their product, and provided scholarships to vet students if they promoted their product. I still don't know if this is true but our dog is thriving, her coat is beautiful, she cannot get enough of this food, and her stools are perfectly solid and no longer runny. Bulldogs have their own set of problems and ours has not been the exception, but I literally am indebted to our vet for directing us to Science Diet. It will give us our dog for many years to come and hope others will try this before heart disease takes their furry friend.
subject: Hill's Science Diet Dry Dog Food, Adult, Sensitive Stomach & Skin, Chicken Recipe, 15.5 lb. Bag

body: Great dog food for dogs with GI problems! I recently switched my old dog over to this food due to chronic stomach problems he has been having the last couple months with nausea/regurgitation/acid reflux/diarrhea (he has been dewormed regularly, on antibiotics and probiotics for diarrhea, on hernia occassionally for nausea, and omeprazole for acid reflux, but still having recurrent problems). My vet recommended seeing how he does on a sensitive stomach food before taking further action. The food has helped tremendously with these issues and he finally has an appetite again! I haven't seen loose stools in a couple weeks and I havent seen him regurgitate his food at all in a couple weeks either. He is also very picky about food and will happily starve himself if food smells unappetizing, but he seems to love this stuff! It almost has a kind of cheesy smell (he loves cheese). It smells better than your typical dog food and both bags I've bought so far seem to be very fresh, not "stale." Would definitely recommend to anyone who has dogs with stomach problems!
